if something is approved, accepted etc pro forma, this is part of the usual way of doing things and does not involve any actual choice or decision
pro-forma figures, results etc are not complete or final, and often do not include money that was spent on extraordinary items
Pro-forma earnings show how much a company would have earned had unusual and one-time charges not occurred.
Their eventual loss compares with pro-forma pretax profit of $14.6 millions.
